sys_embedded_help_content.content:
MID Server list

The MID Server list view shows all the MID Servers associated with the instance, their status, version, and whether or not they are valid. The version of the MID Server must be compatible with the version of the instance. Otherwise, the MID Server cannot process commands or communicate with the instance.

If the version is not compatible, the MID Server status is not changed to Down in the MID Server dashboard. So it might still appear to be processing commands when it actually is not doing so. You must check the MID Server Version on the dashboard, which is available starting with the Istanbul release.

The icons in the Version column indicates the following:
  • Red: The MID Server does not belong to the same release as the instance and is incompatible. You must upgrade the MID Server and verify that it is not pinned to an older version, by using the mid.version.override property. The MID Server will not be upgraded until the parameter is cleared.
  • Yellow: This indicates that the MID Server version belongs to the same family as the instance, but not the same version. This version is compatible, but upgrade is recommended.
  • Green: This MID Server is compatible, and no upgrade is necessary.
  • Gray: The instance cannot detect the version. This MID Server is considered incompatible.
Related information
MID Server upgrades
Validate the MID Server
